thread.title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's final days: From enjoying family holiday to her death in London flat
thread.title_full: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's final days: From enjoying family holiday to her death in London flat

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's final days: From enjoying family holiday to her death in London flat
text:
Get celebs updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Tributes have been flooding in for the late Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, who was found dead in her London flat yesterday. 
She'd lived a life full of secret good deeds, scandal and many highs and lows, including losing part of her nose to her cocaine addiction and being diagnosed with autism in 2014. 
But as mystery surrounds her death, TPT's many fans are still in shock as to how the socialite passed away. 
Despite confirming in November last year that she was battling a brain tumour, Tara continued to live life to the full. Read More What happened to Tara Palmer-Tomkinson? Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's final holiday 
Tara, her brother James and sister Santa, joined their parents Charles and Patti to celebrate their golden wedding anniversary in India before Christmas. 
Tara then travelled to Thailand, where she got caught up in the New Year floods on the resort island of Koh Samui. 
36 people died in the floods in the southern part of the country, with hospitals, airports and highways closed. 
One of Tara's last tweets on January 8th revealed that she'd had a traumatic journey back to the UK. "I'm home!" she tweeted. 
"The floods,disruptions in koh samui,beyond horrendous.What I witnessed,experienced at the airport,disruption,chaos,trauma." 
But, she pointed out, everyone was doing their best to get people home. 
"It was SO emotionally overwhelming the kindness of everyone helping everyone,n my prayers r with those still stuck.X," she added. Read More Tara Palmer-Tomkinson found dead in London flat Her final tweet 
Her last ever tweet came three days later on January 11th, when she told her followers that she'd voted in the National Television Awards. Her last public photo (Photo: Goffphotos.com) Tara was last pictured outside her flat last month (Photo: GoffPhotos.com) 
Tara was last spotted in public on January 25th, two weeks before her body was found. 
She was seen outside her London flat wearing wedge-heeled beige boots, skinny jeans and a navy coat worn open over a colourful stripy jumper. 
Her blonde-brown hair was worn down and she'd donned a pair of sunglasses to keep the winter rays out of her eyes. Read More Tara Palmer-Tomkinson pictured for last time two weeks before her 'unexplained' death Tara Palmer-Tomkinson's final movements 
Police have said they consider Tara's death to be 'unexplained', and it will take a few days for an investigation and autopsy to take place to determine what happened. 
But a group of builders working in the same building as Tara's apartment revealed that they heard a "very loud bang" days before Tara's body was discovered. 
The workers, who were carrying out a in the flat below Tara's, said they heard the noise last Friday, February 3rd. 
One of the builders told The Sun: "We’d hear her walking around up there. 
"But last Friday we heard a very loud bang in the afternoon — like someone or something falling over. 
"We hadn’t seen her or heard her since then." Police were called to Tara's London flat at around 1.40pm on Wednesday (Photo: Rex Features) Paramedics were also spotted outside (Photo: Ian Vogler/DAILY MIRROR) An ambulance crew leave Tara's home (Photo: Ian Vogler/DAILY MIRROR) Tara's body found 
A spokesman for the Met Police said: "Police were called by London Ambulance Service at approximately 1.40pm on Wednesday, 8 February to an address in Bramham Gardens, SW5. 
"A woman, aged in her 40s, was pronounced dead at the scene. Next of kin have been informed. 
"The death is being treated as unexplained. At this early stage, police are not treating the death as suspicious. 
"Enquiries into the circumstances are ongoing. The Coroner has been informed." 
Undertakers were seen removing a body from her £4.4million fifth floor Chelsea flat last night. Dressed in black suits they wheeled a maroon body bag on a trolley to a parked up private ambulance at 5.53pm - four hours after police were called. A police officer stands guard as undertakers remove Tara's body (Photo: Ian Vogler/Daily Mirror) (Photo: Ian Vogler/Daily Mirror) (Photo: Ian Vogler/Daily Mirror) 
A man who claims to be her former housemate said: "I used to live with her and a friend called me today and told me she had died."I'm devastated."A neighbour who saw the former model and IT girl regularly said she hadn't seen Tara in five weeks. The woman, who refused to give her name, said: "I last saw her five weeks ago, but she looked lovely. "I would see her sometimes in the corner shop. She liked to tell people they looked amazing, that was her thing. It's very sad." Read More Tara Palmer-Tomkinson dead: Inside the It Girl's wild and wonderful troubled life Tara Palmer Tomkinson has died, aged 45 (Photo: Getty) 
It's not yet known whether Tara's death could be linked to her brain tumour diagnosis, which she spoke candidly about just three months ago. 
The former I'm A Celebrity star said in November: "I went to the doctors to talk about my latest blood test results when I got back from skiing in January. 
"I said, 'What does this mean? Can you translate it?' And the doctor said, 'As I suspected, you have a brain tumour.'" Tara was last pictured outside her flat last month (Photo: GoffPhotos.com) Tara Palmer-Tomkinson and Duncan James (Photo: Rex Features) Tara Palmer-Tomkinson and Kate Middleton in 2007 (Photo: Rex Features) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
